context: Often, large multinational corporations exhibit <a4_0><b12_0>vertical<b12_0/><a4_0/> integration, <a1_0><b9_0>participating in a broad range of drug discovery and development, manufacturing and quality control, marketing, sales, and distribution<b9_0/><a1_0/>. Smaller organizations, on the other hand, often <a3_0>focus on <a5_0>a specific aspect<a5_0/> such as discovering drug candidates or developing formulations<a3_0/>. Often, <a6_0>collaborative agreements<a6_0/> between research organizations and large pharmaceutical companies are formed <a0_0><b8_0>to explore the potential of new drug substances<b8_0/><a0_0/>. More recently, multi-nationals are increasingly relying on <a7_0>contract research<a7_0/> organizations <a2_0><b10_0><b11_0>to manage drug development<b11_0/><b10_0/><a2_0/>.
